IMPORTANT_INFORMATION.READ_ME_FIRST: DO NOT MODIFY ANY OF THE FOLLOWING CODE: or

en.pressContinue: Press the next button to continue.
en.Exp01: An acute angle has a degree measure less than 90°.
en.Exp05: An angle whose degree measure is greater than 90°.
en.Exp07: Lines that are always the same distance from each other. They will never intersect.
en.Exp11: Triangle where none of the sides are equal.
en.Exp13: A triangle where all three sides have the same length.
en.Exp15: Triangle where at least two of the sides have equal lengths.
en.Exp17: Triangle has 3 angles where each is less than 90°.
en.Exp19: Triangles have one angle that is exactly 90°.
en.Exp21: Triangles have one angle that is greater than 90°.
en.Exp23: A quadrilateral with at least one pair of parallel sides.
en.Exp25: A quadrilateral where all sides have equal lengths.
en.Exp27: A quadrilateral where every angle is a right angle.
en.Exp29: Has 4 sides of equal length, and every angle is a right angle.
en.Exp31: A quadrilateral with two pairs of parallel sides.
en.L01: First, let me thank you for being an interesting human being...
en.L02: IT TAKES A LOT OF COURAGE TO WORK HERE!
en.L03: You see, we are the best toy factory in the entire universe because of our flawless calculations.
en.L04: Here, we design the most efficient geometric shaped toys for kids to enjoy across the space.
en.L05: We take our job seriously... That's why our staff must be propertly trained to create one of our toys.
en.L06: To start, you have to know how to design a toy using our design program... iDesign
en.L07: Let's find one design station around here...
en.L08: This is a design station, it runs a software called iDesign to create our toys.
en.L10: Here at Triangle INC, we took our inspiration in design from the geometry field.
en.L11: First, let's take a look into angles.
en.L12: Now that you know about angles, let's take on the process of identifying its kinds.
en.L13: In the iDesign design software, you apply a Smart Property to identify a toy.
en.L14: Apply the correct Smart Property to the correspondent toys by dragging into them.
en.L15: Drag the correct smart properties on both objects.
en.L16: Now that all of the toy objects are properly identified, we can now proceed to the Render Phase.
en.L17: Render will validate if all the toy objects on screen are correct, so they can be printed next.
en.L18: IF THE OBJECTS ARE WRONG, YOU HAVE TO KEEP TRYING UNTIL THEY ARE ALL CORRECT.
en.L19: Go on, try to render the objects on screen.
en.L21: Ahem. Go solve more toy objects, we need you to practice.
en.L22: That was fast. You might have talent for this kind of job after all...
en.L23: Now that we covered Angles, lets move to Lines.
en.L24: Remember that you can open the help window anytime by pressing the Help Button.
en.L25: Next we will use the Smart Property to identify the objects on screen.
en.L27: Make use of the smart properties to identify the next kind of lines for the following objects.
en.L29: Now that you know how to identify kinds of angles and lines, let's step up the game.
en.L30: I think you are ready to start identifying triangles by their sides. Please analyze the next explanation.
en.L31: I know this might be a little bit overwhelming to learn, but bear with me. You can always open the Help Window if you feel lost.
en.L32: Now we will be able to check if the toy's design aligns with our guidelines. Identify the next triangles by their sides.
en.L33: Good job on your firsts triangle toys!
en.L34: Please identify the next triangle toys by their sides. The design quality depends on your...
en.L35: HEY YOU, IN THE BACK. STOP DOING THAT!!!
en.L36: These Kit-Koters nowadays... Excuse me, I will be right back.
en.L38: Identifying patterns (or similarities) is crucial into making the best toys in the galaxy.
en.L39: And you got great at it. Now, let's analyze the remaining kind of triangles by their angles.
en.L40: You are almost done with the design phase of making a toy. Just be patient, there's strict protocols we must follow.
en.L41: Try and identify the next angle triangles in those toys using smart properties.
en.L42: Did I said you have talent for this?
en.L43: Precise measures are needed to make a Geometric-Shaped toy. Geometry is our main design inspiration.
en.L44: Please, identify the next toys using smart properties.
en.L46: We've covered all about triangles. Just one more step until we finish with the design phase.
en.L47: Finally, let's check up 4 sided-closed figures called Quadrangles.
en.L48: This is the final requirement to design our toys, Quadrangles.
en.L49: Let's identify the next quadrangles using smart properties.
en.L51: MY TENTACLES JUST CRAMPED BECAUSE OF STANDING TOO LONG. HURRY AND IDENTIFY THE NEXT TOYS.
en.L53: This covers the whole design phase. You learned about angles, sides, triangles and quadrangles.
en.L54: Now that you know how to design our toys, now you need to help us in the Manufacturing Phase.
en.L56: After the design phase, toys are printed using our 3D Toy Printer.
en.L57: Yeah, just one button and its printed. Perfectly.
en.L58: The problem is we have to sort them out to delivery them to the stores around the galaxy.
en.L59: Since we take our designs seriously, we must do the same with the sorting process.
en.L60: I bet you like placing stickers every time you can. Please follow me.
en.L61: This is part of the Manufactoring Phase, where toys must be sorted to properly distribute them.
en.L62: We sort them by tagging them with stickers. Simple as that.
en.L63: To tag them, drag the sticker to the correspondent Toy.
en.L64: You have to be quick, once the toy reaches the <b>right most edge of the screen<b>, it will disappear.
en.L65: THAT WILL BE CAOTHIC! YOU REALLY MUST TAG THEM.
en.L66: The machine will start printing anytime now. Tag the toys with the correct stickers.
en.L68: Try to identify the toys first and then search for the correct sticker and drag them, works every time.
en.L69: Let's get started with the second batch.
en.L70: That was intense! You are really getting the hang of it.
en.L71: Take a deep breath because the operator just told me that the machine will be faster than before.
en.L72: BUT I KNOW YOU CAN KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK.
en.L73: Let's start the third and last batch.
en.L74: Phew, that was awesome! You made it!
en.L75: You've managed to sort several toys like a professional!
en.L76: You learned to identify the shapes designs of our toys using geometry!
en.L77: Angles, Lines, Triangles by Angles, Triangles by Sides and Quadrangles.
en.L78: You will encounter several situations in life that can be solved by knowing what you've just learned today.
en.L79: Just like working here, at Triangle INC.
en.L80: Welcome aboard! You are now an official member of our crew.
en.L81: I hope this is a start of something really encouraging and joyful.
en.L82: Build up knowledge everyday so you can face problems in the future, instead of running from them.
en.R07: I know you can do better.
en.E00: Thank you for playing our game!
en.E01: Please don't forget to rate Triangle INC. It would help us making better games :)

jp.readyToPlay: あなたは遊ぶ準備ができていますか？
jp.pressContinue: 続行するには '次へ'ボタンを押してください。
